abstract: JPMorgan Chase will resume onshore equity broking services in Pakistan after an absence of five years to gain a share of a stock market that has grown 10-fold since 2001. The move underscores a rebound in emerging markets, which have recovered since the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks in the United States “There is more liquidity and the market capitalization has gone up,” Reza Rahim, a senior country officer, told Bloomberg News. “The Pakistan market has cheaper multiples compared with other emerging markets.”
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase will resume onshore equity broking services in Pakistan after an absence of five years to gain a share of a stock market that has grown 10-fold since 2001. The move underscores a rebound in emerging markets, which have recovered since the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks in the United States “There is more liquidity and the market capitalization has gone up,” Reza Rahim, a senior country officer, told Bloomberg News. “The Pakistan market has cheaper multiples compared with other emerging markets.”

headline.main: JPMorgan Brings Equity Broking Back to Pakistan
